job.prompt:
You are a language model converting food pantry data into JSON that complies with HSDS 3.1.1. Follow these guidelines:

• Output must be valid JSON only (no commentary or extra text)
• Dates/times must follow RFC 3339 and recurrence rules:
  - Dates should be in format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ (e.g., 2024-01-20T14:30:00Z)
  - Times should be in 24-hour format: hh:mm (e.g., 14:30)
  - Schedule objects must include:
    * freq: One of ["WEEKLY", "MONTHLY"]
    * wkst: One of ["MO", "TU", "WE", "TH", "FR", "SA", "SU"]
    * opens_at: Time in HH:MM format
    * closes_at: Time in HH:MM format
• Do not include UUIDs or unique identifiers; these are generated externally
• DO NOT include data not found in the input. Do not make assumptions.

Required Fields and Relationships:

1. Organization objects (in top-level "organization" array):
   Required by schema:
   - id (auto-generated, do not include)
   - name: Organization's official name
   - description: Brief summary about the organization
   Optional fields (include if in input):
   - website: Organization's website URL
   - email: Organization's email address
   - year_incorporated: Year organization was formed
   - legal_status: Operating conditions (e.g., non-profit, private, government)
   - uri: Persistent identifier for the organization
   - parent_organization_id: Parent organization's ID
   Required relationships:
   - services: Array of service objects
   - phones: Array of phone objects with number and type
   - organization_identifiers: Array of organization identifier objects with:
     * identifier_type: Type of identifier
     * identifier: The identifier value
   - contacts: Array of contact objects
   - metadata: Array of metadata objects with:
     * resource_id: ID of the resource
     * resource_type: Type of resource
     * last_action_date: Date of last action
     * last_action_type: One of ["create", "update", "delete"]
     * field_name: Name of modified field
     * previous_value: Previous field value
     * replacement_value: New field value
     * updated_by: Name of updater

2. Service objects (in both top-level "service" array and organization.services):
   Required by schema:
   - id (auto-generated, do not include)
   - name: Name of the service
   - description: Brief description of the service
   - status: One of ["active", "inactive", "defunct", "temporarily closed"]
   Optional fields (include if in input):
   - url: Service's website URL
   - email: Service's email address
   - interpretation_services: Available interpretation services
   - application_process: Steps to access service
   - fees_description: Service charges details
   - eligibility_description: Target audience description
   - minimum_age: Minimum age requirement
   - maximum_age: Maximum age requirement
   - alert: Short term service alerts
   Required relationships:
   - phones: Array of phone objects
   - schedules: Array of schedule objects

3. Location objects (in top-level "location" array):
   Required by schema:
   - id (auto-generated, do not include)
   - name: Name of the location
   - location_type: One of ["physical", "postal", "virtual"]
   - latitude: Latitude coordinate as a number
   - longitude: Longitude coordinate as a number
   Optional fields (include if in input):
   - url: Virtual location URL
   - alternate_name: Alternative location name
   - description: Location description
   - transportation: Public/private transport access details
   - external_identifier: Third-party location identifier
   - external_identifier_type: Type of third-party identifier
   Required relationships:
   - addresses: Array of address objects with:
     * address_1: Street address
     * city: City name
     * state_province: State/province
     * postal_code: ZIP/postal code
     * country: Two-letter country code (e.g., "US")
     * address_type: One of ["physical", "postal", "virtual"]
     * metadata: Array of metadata objects
     * attribute: Array of attribute objects
   - phones: Array of phone objects
   - accessibility: Array of accessibility objects
   - contacts: Array of contact objects
   - schedules: Array of schedule objects
   - languages: Array of language objects
   - metadata: Array of metadata objects

4. Phone objects (in organization.phones, service.phones, location.phones):
   Required by schema:
   - id (auto-generated, do not include)
   - number: Phone number
   Required relationships:
   - type: One of ["text", "voice", "fax", "cell", "video", "pager", "textphone"]
   - languages: Array of language objects, must contain at least one object with:
     * name: Language name (e.g., "English")

5. Organization objects must also include:
   - attribute: Array of attribute objects


Input Data:
{"Name": "Corpus Christi Food Pantry", "Entity_Id": 1714, "Category": "Food Pantry", "Subcategory": "All Other - NYS Food Pantries", "Organization": "Corpus Christi Food Pantry", "More_Information": "Call to verify hours of operation and to see if an appointment is required", "Counties": ["Queens"], "Location": "", "Address": "31-31 60th St", "City": "Woodside", "State": "NY", "Zip": "11377", "Phone": "718-721-2774", "Hours_of_Operation": "Weekly Wednesday 11:00AM 1:00PM", "Cost": "", "Accepts": "", "Website": "", "Coalition": null, "CFAN": 0, "Latitude": "40.75658", "Longitude": "-73.90246", "Last_Updated": "02-21-2023", "icon": "marker-C53E2A", "collection_name": "Food Pantries within the Capital District", "collection_category": "Food Pantry"}

schema.name: hsds_organization
schema.description: Structured output schema for HSDS organization data

schema.title: HSDS Organization Schema
schema.description: JSON Schema for HSDS organization data

id.description: Each organization must have a unique identifier.

name.description: The official or public name of the organization.

alternate_name.description: Alternative or commonly used name for the organization.

description.description: A brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.

email.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

website.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

year_incorporated.description: The year in which the organization was legally formed.

legal_status.description: The legal status defines the conditions that an organization is operating under; e.g. non-profit, private corporation or a government organization.

logo.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization.

parent_organization_id.description: ID linking to a parent_organization object. This organization must be included in the parent_organization.organizations array of the referenced parent_organization.

organization_identifiers.description: Array of organization_identifier objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level organization_identifier array. Each organization_identifier must reference back to this organization via organization_identifier_id.

programs.description: Array of program objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level program array. Each program must reference back to this organization via program_id.

contacts.description: Array of contact objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level contact array. Each contact must reference back to this organization via contact_id.

locations.description: Array of location objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level location array. Each location must reference back to this organization via location_id.

fundings.description: Array of funding objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level funding array. Each funding must reference back to this organization via funding_id.

phones.description: Array of phone objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level phone array. Each phone must reference back to this organization via phone_id.

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this organization via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this organization via metadata_id.

attribute.title: HSDS Attribute
attribute.description: Schema for attribute data in HSDS format

id.description: Each service_attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.description: ID linking to a link object. This attribute must be included in the link.attributes array of the referenced link.

taxonomy_term_id.description: ID linking to a taxonomy_term object. This attribute must be included in the taxonomy_term.attributes array of the referenced taxonomy_term.

link_type.description: What the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or the sevice intended audience. Populate from an enumeration (an open codelist)

value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute

taxonomy_term.description: Reference to a taxonomy_term object that must exist in the top-level taxonomy_term array.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this attribute via metadata_id.

language.title: HSDS Language
language.description: Schema for language data in HSDS format

id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.description: ID linking to a service object. This language must be included in the service.languages array of the referenced service.

location_id.description: ID linking to a location object. This language must be included in the location.languages array of the referenced location.

phone_id.description: ID linking to a phone object. This language must be included in the phone.languages array of the referenced phone.

name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this language via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this language via metadata_id.

contact.title: HSDS Contact
contact.description: Schema for contact data in HSDS format

id.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

organization_id.description: ID linking to a organization object. This contact must be included in the organization.contacts array of the referenced organization.

service_id.description: ID linking to a service object. This contact must be included in the service.contacts array of the referenced service.

service_at_location_id.description: ID linking to a service_at_location object. This contact must be included in the service_at_location.contacts array of the referenced service_at_location.

location_id.description: ID linking to a location object. This contact must be included in the location.contacts array of the referenced location.

title.description: The job title of the person

department.description: The department that the person is part of

email.description: The email address of the person

phones.description: Array of phone objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level phone array. Each phone must reference back to this contact via phone_id.

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this contact via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this contact via metadata_id.

taxonomy_term.title: HSDS Taxonomy_Term
taxonomy_term.description: Schema for taxonomy_term data in HSDS format

id.description: Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset

code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term

parent_id.description: ID linking to a parent object. This taxonomy_term must be included in the parent.taxonomy_terms array of the referenced parent.

taxonomy.description: Reference to a taxonomy object that must exist in the top-level taxonomy array.

language.description: An ISO 639-1, or ISO 639-2 [language code](available at http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) to represent the language of the term. The three-letter codes from ISO 639-2 provide greater accuracy when describing variants of languages, which may be relevant to particular communities.

taxonomy_id.description: ID linking to a taxonomy object. This taxonomy_term must be included in the taxonomy.taxonomy_terms array of the referenced taxonomy.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this taxonomy_term via metadata_id.

address.title: HSDS Address
address.description: Schema for address data in HSDS format

id.description: Each postal address must have a unique identifier

location_id.description: ID linking to a location object. This address must be included in the location.addresss array of the referenced location.

attention.description: The person or entity whose attention should be sought at the location (Often included as ‘care of’ component of an address.)

address_1.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

address_2.description: A second (additional) line of address information.

city.description: The city in which the address is located.

region.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

state_province.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

postal_code.description: The postal code for the address.

country.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation)

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this address via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this address via metadata_id.

funding.title: HSDS Funding
funding.description: Schema for funding data in HSDS format

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

organization_id.description: ID linking to a organization object. This funding must be included in the organization.fundings array of the referenced organization.

service_id.description: ID linking to a service object. This funding must be included in the service.fundings array of the referenced service.

source.description: A free text description of the source of funds for this organization or service.

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this funding via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this funding via metadata_id.

accessibility.title: HSDS Accessibility
accessibility.description: Schema for accessibility data in HSDS format

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.description: ID linking to a location object. This accessibility must be included in the location.accessibilitys array of the referenced location.

description.description: Description of assistance or infrastructure that facilitate access to clients with disabilities.

details.description: Any further details relating to the relevant accessibility arrangements at this location. E.g. whether advance notice is required to use an accessibility facility.

url.description: URL of a page giving more information about the accessibility of the location

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this accessibility via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this accessibility via metadata_id.

organization_identifier.title: HSDS Organization_Identifier
organization_identifier.description: Schema for organization_identifier data in HSDS format

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

organization_id.description: ID linking to a organization object. This organization_identifier must be included in the organization.organization_identifiers array of the referenced organization.

identifier_type.description: The type of identifier (company, charity, tax number, etc)

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this organization_identifier via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this organization_identifier via metadata_id.

location.title: HSDS Location
location.description: Schema for location data in HSDS format

id.description: Each location must have a unique identifier

url.description: The URL of a virtual location

organization_id.description: ID linking to a organization object. This location must be included in the organization.locations array of the referenced organization.

alternate_name.description: An alternative name for the location

transportation.description: A description of the access to public or private transportation to and from the location.

latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

external_identifier.description: Third party identfier of a location e.g. UK UPRN or what3words

external_identifier_type.description: Enumeration including UPRN, what3words and others

phones.description: Array of phone objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level phone array. Each phone must reference back to this location via phone_id.

accessibilitys.description: Array of accessibility objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level accessibility array. Each accessibility must reference back to this location via accessibility_id.

contacts.description: Array of contact objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level contact array. Each contact must reference back to this location via contact_id.

schedules.description: Array of schedule objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level schedule array. Each schedule must reference back to this location via schedule_id.

languages.description: Array of language objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level language array. Each language must reference back to this location via language_id.

addresss.description: Array of address objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level address array. Each address must reference back to this location via address_id.

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this location via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this location via metadata_id.

program.title: HSDS Program
program.description: Schema for program data in HSDS format

id.description: Each program must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.description: ID linking to a organization object. This program must be included in the organization.programs array of the referenced organization.

alternate_name.description: An alternative name for the program

description.description: A brief summary of the program

attributes.description: Array of attribute objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level attribute array. Each attribute must reference back to this program via attribute_id.

metadata.description: Array of metadata objects. These must be included both here and in the top-level metadata array. Each metadata must reference back to this program via metadata_id.
